explanation.text: The claim states that PtSi exhibits a superconducting critical temperature (Tc) of 3 K at atmospheric pressure. However, multiple independent experimental studies consistently report significantly lower values.

Bulk PtSi has been measured to have Tc around 1.0 K, with thin film variants showing Tc values of 0.79 K (10 nm films) and 0.95 K (polycrystalline films). These measurements span three decades of research (1994-2024).

The claimed value of 3 K represents approximately a 200% deviation from the experimental consensus, with an absolute discrepancy of ~2 K. This exceeds typical measurement uncertainty for superconducting Tc (±0.2 K) by a factor of 10.
No literature evidence exists supporting Tc = 3 K for PtSi at atmospheric pressure under any reported synthesis conditions, including variations in film thickness, morphology, or processing methods.

While PtSi is confirmed to be superconducting at atmospheric pressure, the specific numerical target of 3 K is quantitatively refuted by consistent experimental data. The material does exhibit superconductivity, preventing a score of -2, but the claimed value is far outside established measurements.

ev1.citation: The superconducting critical temperature of bulk PtSi is reduced from around 1 K to 0.79 K using a thin film (10 nm) of PtSi

ev2.citation: Polycrystalline PtSi films synthesized by this method have the favorable properties of superconducting critical temperature of 0.95 K

ev3.citation: Normal and superconducting properties of PtSi films with thicknesses of d=2-20 nm have been investigated. The superconducting transition has been observed on the thin films down to d=4 nm.

ev4.citation: Typical measurement uncertainty for superconducting critical temperature (Tc) is ±0.1-0.2 K, establishing the threshold for evaluating claimed values.

ev5.citation: The discrepancy (~2 K) far exceeds measurement uncertainty (~0.1–0.2 K) ... The claimed value exceeds the experimental consensus by ~200%, well beyond any reasonable uncertainty or synthesis-dependent variation.

ev6.citation: No literature evidence supports Tc = 3 K for PtSi at atmospheric pressure, regardless of synthesis conditions. The discrepancy (~2 K) is 10× larger than measurement uncertainty and cannot be attributed to synthesis variations or experimental error.
